definition.text: The tutorial hierarchy features a free arrangement of Tutorial Topic and Tutorial Step nodes that make up a tutorial. Each node in the hierarchy, including the parent tutorial node, represents an HTML page that is overlaid on top of both the design space and the charting space.

paragraphs.text: Content
Nodes in the hierarchy may be arranged freely, meaning that there may be as many tutorial topics and tutorial steps as desired.

In general terms, all types of nodes behave similarly in the sense that each node, independently of the precise type, represents a tutorial step in and of itself. Subtle differences shall be covered where appropriate.
The key similarity among all types of nodes in the hierarchy is that all of them may draw content from a tutorial page in the Docs.
Configuring
Tutorial Configuration

The configuration of each node in the tutorial hierarchy determines the content and behavior of each step. All types of nodes share the same basic configuration. However, Tutorial Step nodes have extra properties, described elsewhere.
The layout of the HTML page follows the layout of the referenced page in the Docs, although displayed within the confines of the tutorial window.
In other words, you affect the layout of the step by writing content and applying styles to individual paragraphs in the associated Docs Page.

The HTML page features a limited space and does not support scrolling. If too much information is defined in the associated Docs Page, the resulting content overflows the available space in the tutorial window. There is no system-side control to deal with such overflows, so it's up to you to spread information across multiple steps and keep each page within its limits.
Properties

icon: the name and project of one of the icons stored in the \Projects\[Project-Name]\Iconsfolder, without the extension. When the configuration exists, the icon is placed within a table, on the left-hand side of the text block featured in the definition field. When there is no icon, the definition occupies the full width.
position: determines the position of the floating HTML. There are three alternatives... "Left", "Right", or leave the field empty to position the page in the center of the screen.
"position": "Left"
slider: determines the position of the horizontal slider. There are three alternatives... "toTop", "toBottom", "toMiddle".
"slider": "toBottom"

pressButton: allows you to forcefully "Stop" the tutorial, go to the "Next" step, go to the "Previous" step, or "Skip" a step. When a step is loaded and one of these options is configured in this property, the action is applied immediately. A common use of this feature is to skip a step, for instance, a Tutorial Topic node that is used solely for organizational purposes within the hierarchy, thus has no content.
"pressButton": "Next"

docs: the property is used to reference the Docs Tutorial Page that feeds content to the particular tutorial step. The definition requires the name of the Project, the Docs Page Category which is always Tutorial, and the complete name of the tutorial step page.

controlDocs: the property is used to control the behavior of the Docs panel. The panel property may be set to "Open" or "Close". The property closeTutorialEditor may switch on (true) and off (false) the Docs editor. When set to false, the Docs panel shows the page corresponding to the active tutorial step or the page in the Docs that is requested. When the property is set to true and there is no request to open a Docs page, then the Docs panel shows the search box. The page property is where you define which page in the Docs must be loaded. You must specify the Project, the Docs Page Category, and the type which is the complete name of the page.
